item.title: Creating code chunks
item.description: MathJax.Hub.Config({ TeX: { equationNumbers: {autoNumber: "all"} } }); Testing code chunk outputs The below code should be highlighted. require(plotly) gdf <- data.frame(A = sample(500), B = sample(500)) require(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(gdf, aes(A, B)) + geom_point(color = "pink", size = 3, show.legend = F) + geom_line(color = "black", show.

item.title: pergamino in MDE
item.description: That time in Medellin Removed pergamino.jpg from blog/ folder. CHECK. Changed image size in static/ folder. CHECK. Changed image completely and didn't push.

item.title: blog template
item.description: MathJax.Hub.Config({ TeX: { equationNumbers: {autoNumber: "all"} } }); Define equations Writing math expressions $c^{2} = a^{2} + b^{2}$ (with backticks) and \(c^{2} = a^{2} + b^{2}\) (without backticks). \[ \phi n(r,t) = \sum_{i, j} a(p_{i},E_{j}) e^{ \frac{i} {h} (p_{i} \cdot r - E_{j}t) } \] Display figs side by side boxplot(1:10) plot(rnorm(10)) Create divs Praise the lord, I was born to travel Feeling like Slash in front of the chapel

item.title: How To Setup Timer Hugo
item.description: Install this template by following those simple steps: STEP-1 : Hugo installation Check this link below for install hugo on your computer. hugo install documentation STEP-2 : Create your project Hugo provides a new command to create a new website. hugo new site <new_project> STEP-3 : Install the theme Run this command hugo new site timer-hugo and then go to the themes folder inside of timer-hugo folder. You can also use this command cd timer-hugo/themes for going to this folder.
